info.name: Vast.ai API
info.description: Welcome to Vast.ai 's API documentation. Our API allows you to programmatically manage GPU instances, handle machine operations, and automate your AI/ML workflow. Whether you're running individual GPU instances or managing a fleet of machines, our API provides comprehensive control over all Vast.ai  platform features.

request.description:
Adds a network disk to be used to create network volume offers, or adds machines to an existing network disk.
CLI Usage: vast add network_disk <machine_id>... <mount_point> [options]

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Forbidden

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to detach the SSH key from
(Required) Numeric ID of the SSH key to detach

request.description:
Detaches an SSH key from a specified instance, removing SSH access for
that key.


CLI Usage: vastai detach <instance_id> <ssh_key_id>

Example: vastai detach 99999 12345

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Instance or SSH key not found

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Internal Server Error

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to attach the SSH key to

request.description:
Attaches an SSH key to the specified instance, allowing SSH access using the provided key.

CLI Usage: vast attach instance_id ssh_key

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to destroy

request.description:
Destroys/deletes an instance permanently. This is irreversible and will delete all data.

CLI Usage: vast-ai destroy instance <id>
Example: vast-ai destroy instance 4242

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Too many requests

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to modify

request.description:
Manage instance state and labels. The operation is determined by the request body parameters.

CLI Usage:
- To stop: vastai stop instance <ID>
- To start: vastai start instance <ID>
- To label: vastai label instance <ID> <label>

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the instance to retrieve.

request.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific instance for the authenticated user.
This endpoint returns detailed information including SSH connection parameters, instance state, resource utilization, template data, and pricing details.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Bad Request – Invalid instance ID or invalid arguments.

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Too Many Requests – API requests are too frequent.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) Instance ID

request.description:
Change the current bid price of an instance to a specified price.
CLI Usage: vastai change bid id [--price PRICE]

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Not Found

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to execute command on

request.description:
Executes a constrained remote command on a specified instance.
The command output can be retrieved from the returned result URL.

CLI Usage: vastai execute <instance_id> <command>
Example: vastai execute 12345 "ls -l"

response.name: Command queued successfully

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to get logs from

request.description:
Request logs from a specific instance. The logs will be uploaded to S3 and
can be retrieved from a generated URL. Supports both container logs and daemon
system logs.

CLI Usage: vast logs INSTANCE_ID [--tail LINES] [--filter GREP] [--daemon-logs]

response.name: Success response with S3 URL for log retrieval

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Not authorized

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to prepay for

request.description:
Deposit credits into a reserved instance to receive usage discounts.
The discount rate is calculated based on how many months of usage the prepaid amount covers.
Maximum discount is typically 40%.

CLI Usage: vastai prepay instance <ID> <AMOUNT>
Example: vastai prepay instance 1234 500.0

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to reboot

request.description:
Stops and starts a container without losing GPU priority. Updates container status to 'rebooting'
and executes docker stop/start commands on the host machine.

CLI Usage: vastai reboot instance <ID>

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the instance to recycle

request.description:
Destroys and recreates container in place (from newly pulled image) without losing GPU priority.
Updates container status to 'recycling' and executes docker stop/remove commands on the host machine.

CLI Usage: vastai recycle instance <ID>

CLI Usage: vast show deposit {ID}

request.description: Initiate a remote copy operation to transfer data from one instance to another or between an instance and the local machine.

response.name: Remote copy initiated successfully.

response.name: Source or destination ID not found or access denied.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Cancels an in-progress remote sync operation identified by the destination instance ID.
This operation cannot be resumed once canceled and must be restarted if needed.

response.name: Sync operation canceled successfully.
Invalid request due to missing or incorrect parameters.

request.description: Starts a cloud copy operation by sending a command to the remote server. The operation can transfer data between an instance and a cloud service.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Bad request due to invalid parameters or cloud service.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Resets the API key for the authenticated user. This operation generates a new API key and invalidates the old one.

CLI Usage: vast-ai reset api-key

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer
Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Transfers specified amount of credits from the authenticated user's account to another user's account.
The recipient can be specified by either email address or user ID.

CLI Usage: vast.py transfer credit <recipient_email> <amount>

request.description: Cancel a scheduled maintenance window for a specified machine.

response.name: Maintenance window successfully canceled.

request.description:
This endpoint removes expired contracts on a specified machine, freeing up space.

CLI Usage: vast-ai cleanup machine {machine_id}

request.description:
Deletes the default job (background instances) for a specified machine.

CLI Usage: vast-ai remove defjob {machine_id}

variable.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the machine.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of the most recent reports for a given machine. Each report includes details such as the problem identified, a message describing the issue, and the timestamp when the report was created.

CLI Usage: vastai reports <machine_id>

response.name: An array of reports for the specified machine.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

variable.description: (Required) ID of the machine to schedule maintenance for.

request.description:
Schedules a maintenance window for a specified machine and notifies clients.

CLI Usage: vast-ai schedule maint {machine_id} --sdate {sdate} --duration {duration}

request.description:

CLI Usage: vast set min-bid {machine_id} --price {price}

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the machine to unlist.

request.description:
Removes all 'ask' type offer contracts for a specified machine, effectively unlisting it from being available for rent.

CLI Usage: vastai unlist machine <id>

request.description:
Creates or updates ask contracts for a machine to list it for rent on the vast.ai platform.
Allows setting pricing, minimum GPU requirements, end date and discount rates.

CLI Usage: vast list machine <machine_id> [options]

request.description:
Creates default jobs (background instances) for a specified machine with the given parameters.

CLI Usage: vast set defjob {machine_id} --price_gpu {price} --price_inetu {price} --price_inetd {price} --image {image} [--args {args}]

variable.description: (Required) ID of the API key to delete

request.description:
Deletes an existing API key belonging to the authenticated user.
The API key is soft-deleted by setting a deleted_at timestamp.

CLI Usage: vastai delete api-key ID

request.description:
Creates a new API key with specified permissions for the authenticated user.

CLI Usage: vast create api-key --name NAME --permission_file PERMISSIONS [--key_params PARAMS]

Example:
vast create api-key --name "read-only" --permission_file permissions.json

request.description:
Creates a new encrypted environment variable for the authenticated user.
Keys are automatically converted to uppercase. Values are encrypted before storage.
There is a limit on the total number of environment variables per user.

CLI Usage: vast create env-var KEY VALUE

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

response.name: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key

request.description:
Deletes an environment variable associated with the authenticated user.
The variable must exist and belong to the requesting user.

CLI Usage: vastai delete env-var <name>

body.raw:
{
  "template_id": 89,
  "template_hash_id": "abc123def456",
  "image": "tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-gpu",
  "disk": 32,
  "extra_env": {
    "JUPYTER_TOKEN": "abc123"
  },
  "runtype": "jupyter",
  "onstart": "pip install -r requirements.txt",
  "label": "training-job-1",
  "image_login": "-u username -p password docker.io",
  "price": 0.4,
  "target_state": "running",
  "cancel_unavail": true,
  "vm": false,
  "client_id": "me",
  "apikey_id": "string"
}

variable.description: (Required) ID of the offer to accept

request.description:
Creates a new instance by accepting an "ask" contract from a provider. This is the main endpoint for launching new instances on Vast.ai.
CLI Usage: vast create instance <offer_id> [options]

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

request.description:
Creates a new team with the authenticated user as the owner. The user's existing API key
becomes the owner key for the team. The user cannot already be a team or be a member of another team.

The operation:
1. Converts the user into a team
2. Creates default team roles (member, manager, owner)
3. Converts user's API key into the owner key
4. Adds the creating user as a team member

CLI Usage: vast create team --name <team_name>

request.description:
Search for available GPU machine offers with advanced filtering and sorting.  
Default filters applied unless --no-default: - verified: true - external: false - rentable: true - rented: false  
CLI Usage Examples: `vast search offers 'reliability > 0.99 num_gpus>=4' vast search offers 'gpu_name=RTX_3090' --order=dph_total vast search offers 'cuda_vers>=11.0' --no-default`
